newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SAP adds software for public sector.
newsitem.headline: SAP adds software for public sector.

text.p: German software developer SAP AG on Wednesday released a version of its business software for public agencies.

The company also announced software for the European market that cut down the time it takes to install R/3, a sprawling programme used to manage financial, manufacturing, personnel and other data spread throughout corporations.
SAP Public Sector is a version of R/3 aimed at international institutions, governments and non-profit organisations, SAP said at Sapphire 97, its annual customer exposition.
The product is one of a series that SAP hopes will broaden sales beyond its traditional customer base of large multinational corporations.

AcceleratedSAP consists of software programmes designed to ease the R/3 installation process, which can take six months or more. It was introduced in the United States last year and is now available in Europe.
SAP planned to offer AcceleratedSAP in the Asia-Pacific markets in the third quarter.

The company also said cosmetics group L'Oreal would install R/3 to consolidate finance, accounting, material resource and operations data at branches in 59 countries. It would make the 10,000th R/3 installation, SAP said.
